Proxy.label: Legacy VTK Reader
Proxy.name: legacyreader

Documentation.long_help: Reads files stored in VTK's legacy file format.

Proxy.Documentation: The Legacy VTK reader loads files stored in VTK's legacy file format. The expected file extension is .vtk. The type of the dataset may be structured grid, uniform rectilinear grid (image/volume), non-uniform rectilinear grid, unstructured grid, or polygonal.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the file name for the Legacy VTK reader.

SourceProxy.label: Legacy VTK Reader
SourceProxy.name: LegacyVTKFileReader

Documentation.long_help: Reads files stored in VTK's legacy file format.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Legacy VTK reader loads files stored in VTK's legacy file format (before VTK 4.2, although still supported). The expected file extension is .vtk. The type of the dataset may be structured grid, uniform rectilinear grid (image/volume), non-uniform rectilinear grid, unstructured grid, or polygonal. This reader also supports file series.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileNames
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of files to be read by the reader. If more than one file is specified, the reader will switch to file series mode in which it will pretend that it can support time and provide one file per time step.

SourceProxy.label: Partitioned Legacy VTK Reader
SourceProxy.name: pvtkfile

Documentation.long_help: Reads files stored in VTK partitioned legacy format.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Partitioned Legacy VTK reader loads files stored in VTK's partitioned legacy file format (before VTK 4.2, although still supported). The expected file extension is .pvtk. The type of the dataset may be structured grid, uniform rectilinear grid (image/volume), non-uniform rectilinear grid, unstructured grid, or polygonal.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the file name for the Partitioned Legacy VTK reader.

SourceProxy.name: OpenFOAMReader

Documentation.long_help: Reads OpenFOAM data files, producing multiblock dataset.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The OpenFOAM reader reads OpenFOAM data files and outputs multiblock datasets. Mesh information and time dependent data are supported. The OpenFOAM format is described fully at http://www.openfoam.com/docs/user/basic-file-format.php

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the file name for the reader.

Property.name: Refresh
Property.Documentation: Refresh time information and selection list metadata. Useful when watching a running simulation.

IntVectorProperty.name: SkipZeroTime
IntVectorProperty.label: Skip Zero Time
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Ignore the 0/ time directory.

IntVectorProperty.name: CaseType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The property indicates whether decomposed mesh or reconstructed mesh should be read

IntVectorProperty.label: Label Size
IntVectorProperty.name: Use64BitLabels
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The expected label-size for the OpenFOAM data.

IntVectorProperty.label: Scalar Size
IntVectorProperty.name: Use64BitFloats
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The expected scalar-size for the OpenFOAM data.

IntVectorProperty.label: Create cell-to-point filtered data
IntVectorProperty.name: CreateCellToPoint
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Create point data from cell data. Beware: the filter does not do inverse distance weighting.

IntVectorProperty.label: Add dimensional units to array names
IntVectorProperty.name: AddDimensionsToArrayNames
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Read dimensional units from field data and add them to array names as human-readable string.

IntVectorProperty.label: Cache mesh
IntVectorProperty.name: CacheMesh
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Cache the OpenFOAM mesh between GUI selection changes.

IntVectorProperty.label: Decompose polyhedra
IntVectorProperty.name: DecomposePolyhedra
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Decompose polyhedra into tetrahedra and pyramids.

IntVectorProperty.label: List timesteps according to controlDict
IntVectorProperty.name: ListTimeStepsByControlDict
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: List time directories listed according to the settings in controlDict.

IntVectorProperty.label: Lagrangian positions without extra data
IntVectorProperty.name: PositionsIsIn13Format
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Lagrangian positions without extra data (before OpenFOAM 1.4, after 2.4)

IntVectorProperty.label: Read zones
IntVectorProperty.name: ReadZones
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Read point/face/cell-Zones?

IntVectorProperty.label: Copy data to cell zones
IntVectorProperty.name: CopyDataToCellZones
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Copy data of internal mesh to the cell zones

SourceProxy.label: PLOT3D Reader
SourceProxy.name: P3DReader

Documentation.long_help: Reads ASCII or binary PLOT3D files.

SourceProxy.Documentation: PLOT3D is a plotting package developed at NASA. The PLOT3D reader can read both ASCII and binary PLOT3D files. The default file extension for the geometry files is .xyz, and the default file extension for the solution files is .q. The output of this reader is a multiblock dataset containing curvilinear (structured grid) datasets.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the .xyz (geometry) file name for the PLOT3D reader.

StringVectorProperty.name: QFileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The list of .q (solution) files for the PLOT3D reader. There can be more than one. If more that one file is specified, the reader will switch to file-series mode in which it will pretend that it can support time and provide one file per time step.

StringVectorProperty.name: FunctionFileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the .f (function) file name for the PLOT3D reader.

IntVectorProperty.name: AutoDetectFormat
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When this options is enabled, the reader will try to automatically figure out various settings for a binary file. The other options are ignored. Does not work for text (ASCII) files.

IntVectorProperty.name: BinaryFile
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates whether the data files are binary.

IntVectorProperty.name: MultiGrid
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates whether these files have multiple-block information.

IntVectorProperty.name: HasByteCount
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates whether this file uses Fortran leading-trailing byte counts.

IntVectorProperty.name: IBlanking
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates whether this dataset has visibility information.

IntVectorProperty.name: TwoDimensionalGeometry
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates whether the data is two- or three-dimensional.

IntVectorProperty.name: ForceRead
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates whether to attempt to read the file even if it appears corrupt

IntVectorProperty.name: DoublePrecision
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies whether floating points values are in double precision.

IntVectorProperty.name: ByteOrder
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the byte order of any binary file(s).

IntVectorProperty.name: Functions
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property lists which functions (point-centered arrays) to compute.

IntVectorProperty.name: PreserveIntermediateFunctions
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When checked, the reader will preserve intermediate computed quantities that were not explicitly requested e.g. if **Velocity magnitude** is enabled, but not **Velocity**, the reader still needs to compute **Velocity**. If this is unchecked, then the output will not have **Velocity** array, only the requested **VelocityMagnitude**. This is useful to avoid using up memory for arrays that are not relevant for the analysis.

SourceProxy.label: PLOT3D Meta-File Reader
SourceProxy.name: Plot3DMetaReader

Documentation.short_help: The main goal of this reader is to make it easy to read PLOT3D files or time series of PLOT3D files.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The main goal of this reader is to make it easy to read PLOT3D files, specifically time series of PLOT3D files. PLOT3D files can take many different forms based on their content. Unfortunately, it is not a self-describing format therefore the user needs to pass information about the contents of the file to the reader. Normally, this is done by setting a number of member variables. The goal of this reader is to provide a simple format that enable the writer of the PLOT3D file to describe its settings as well as group a number of files as a time series.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the meta file name
